dmca.title: Copyright Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Clearwater Landscape Design [mailto:support@clearwaterlandscapes.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, February 15, 2005 8:54 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Copyright Infringement



From:

Dan Eskelson
Clearwater Landscapes, Inc.
97 Juneberry Ln
Priest River, ID 83856
208-265-5881

To:
Lance Crosby, Esq.
Chief Operating Officer
The Planet


Re: Copyright Infringement
Takedown Command 17 USC 512(c)(3)

Dear Sir,

Demand is hereby made in accordance with 17 USC 512(c)(3) for
removal of your hosted website at
http://paydesign.com/landscape-design.htm


which contains illegally used text. I first copyright
registered this work with the Library of Congress'
Copyright Office in 2003. Your client does not have
permission to use this material.

The specific text copied is:

Several paragraphs on the page referenced above, beginning
with:

"New lawn installations should start with basic soil
considerations;...

Please compare this material to the copyrighted page at:
http://clearwaterlandscapes.com/soil.htm

Because my site is near the top of several search engines, I
find these abuses several times per month. It is extremely
unfortunate that I must follow this course, but if I don't
protect my copyrighted material, no one else will.

If you have any questions regarding the dates of origination
of our content, please check the Alexa Archive. Our site has
been indexed and archived there since 1998.

To the site owner or webmaster - please review our legal
statement at the link below, especially the section
regarding penalty for copyright infringement:
http://clearwaterlandscapes.com/legal.htm

I declare that I am authorized to represent myself in this
matter as I am the owner of an exclusive right that is
allegedly infringed. I have a good faith belief that use of
the material in the manner complained of is not authorized
by the copyright owner, its agent or the law, and that the
information contained in this notification is accurate. I
declare under penalty of perjury that the foregoing is true
and correct.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please
consider the following my official electronic signature.

Sincerely,

Dan Eskelson
Clearwater Landscape Design
support@clearwterlandscapes.com
http://clearwaterlandscapes.com
